en_title: Secretary for Justice to visit London

en: The Secretary for Justice, Ms Teresa Cheng, SC, will depart for London tomorrow night (November 13). She will meet with key figures in the UK business and legal sectors to promote Hong Kong's role as a dispute resolution and deal-making hub.
Ms Cheng will deliver a speech entitled "The Search for Order within Chaos in the Evolution of ISDS" at the Alexander Lecture 2019 organised by the Chartered Institute of Arbitrators on November 14.

She will meet with key business leaders and senior legal practitioners to introduce the Department of Justice's latest initiatives in strengthening Hong Kong as a dispute resolution and deal-making hub, and update them on the latest legal developments in Hong Kong. She will also call on the Chinese Ambassador to the UK, Mr Liu Xiaoming.
Ms Cheng will arrive in Hong Kong in the morning on November 18.
zh: 律政司司長鄭若驊資深大律師明日（十一月十三日）晚上前赴英國倫敦，在當地向商界及法律界推廣香港作為促成交易和爭議解決樞紐的角色。
鄭若驊十一月十四日會出席特許仲裁學會舉辦的講座「Alexander Lecture 2019」，並就投資者與東道國之間爭議解決機制的演變發表演說。
在倫敦期間，鄭若驊會與商界領袖和資深法律界人士會面，介紹律政司在加強香港作為促成交易和爭議解決樞紐的最新措施，以及向他們講解香港法律方面的最新發展。她亦會拜會中國駐英國大使劉曉明。
鄭若驊將於十一月十八日上午返抵香港。

She will also call on the Chinese Ambassador to the UK, Mr Liu Xiaoming.
